_comment: Created by EFisher on 17/02/2016 18:39:22 using v2.7
title: Do outpatients report having their appointment date changed?
analysis_commentary: For outpatients, there is an increase in the proportion of patients reporting that their appointment date had been changed from 20 per cent in 2004 to 23 per cent in 2011. It appears that repeat appointments contribute more heavily to this overall change, with 26 per cent of those attending a repeat appointment reporting a change in date compared to just 14 per cent of those attending a first appointment. Again, we see little connection to experiences reported in the Outpatient Survey reflecting the changes in cancelled operations data above.
